cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles E of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest across the eastern Gulf, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend on Wednesday, then accelerate north-northeast across southeast Georgia and the Carolinas and off the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near/just south of Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge and Tropical-Storm Watches extend west of the Florida Big Bend (Aucilla River to Indian Pass, FL).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-Storm and Storm-Surge Warnings in effect for Florida Keys and Florida west coast from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and west coast, then the Georgia and South Carolina coasts northward to the Mid-Atlantic and New England.
weather_observation.wind: 20–30 mph sustained with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible late Wednesday into early Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible; major surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with pockets to 6 inches Wednesday-Thursday, producing localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes and very rough seas/strong currents; potential temporary channel restrictions for shipping traffic.
